post_text: Welcome, Officer Trent Howard! We look forward to your service as our School Resource Officer at Portage High School West. #PortageProud
shared_text:
Portage Police Department (Indiana)
August 26 at 8:59 AM ·

We are proud to announce that Master Patrol Officer Trent Howard has been selected as a full-time School Resource Officer to serve within the Portage Township School system. Officer Howard has been a member of the Portage Police Department for five years where he has been assigned to the patrol division as well as serving as a member of the department’s SWAT team. Officer Howard is accredited by the National Association of School Resource Officers’ and has previously worked as an SRO on a part-time basis with PTS. Officer Howard was selected for this position in collaboration with PTS in part due to his ten years of experience working as a youth baseball coach and the positive feedback from his players. Prior to coming to law enforcement Offc. Howard had been drafted as a pitcher by a Double-A Major League Baseball team and has been sharing his skills and knowledge of the game since then. We are excited to have a Portage officer returning to PTS and expect great things to come.

Congratulations to Portage High School paraprofessional and Class of 2011 graduate Tori Bliss, who has been selected as an inductee to the Indiana Track and Field Hall of Fame!

Ms. Bliss was a member of the PHS Track and Field Team, throwing shot put and discuss. She took first place in shot put her senior year, among other honors, setting the stage for a successful run at Louisiana State University.

Ms. Bliss is happy to return to PHS and give back to the students at her high school. In additional to serving as a paraprofessional, Ms. Bliss also coaches track and field and basketball. She credits her coaches, especially Coach Harsha, for supporting her along the way and encouraging her to work at her craft with full intensity, a lesson that has stuck with her since high school.

Congratulations! #PortageProud

Mrs. Hindsley’s sixth grade math class at Fegely Middle School took on a colorful challenge! The students were challenged to combine a set of four numbers using only four operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division) and only using the numbers once, but making each set equal 24. They catch is that they had to complete the challenge in under one minute! The first person to solve and explain their answer received a point, and the student with the most points at the end of the activity received their favorite SKITTLES in the mail from Mrs. Hindsley! Even their principal, Mrs. Caballero, participated in the challenge and won!

Great job to Mrs. Hindsley and her class! #PortageProud

Our next Meal Pick-Up Program will take place Monday, May 11 from 11:00 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. at PHS West! Stop by to pick up a week of breakfasts and lunches for your PTS student.

Questions? Email us at ptscommunications@portage.k12.in.us.

We are so proud of Willowcreek Middle School seventh grader Evan Chubbuck for working on a special independent project for our healthcare workers!

Evan is a member of the robotics team at Willowcreek and is using what he has learned about mechanics and 3-D printing to make "ear savers." Healthcare workers are wearing masks during their entire shift, and the elastic on the mask can be uncomfortable on their ears. Evan 3-D printed a device that fits around the back of the head and holds the elastic so healthcare workers don't have to wear them on their ears. He is donating these "ear savers" to his aunts, who are nurses, and their co-workers.

Great job, Evan, on being a model citizen and demonstrating the power of kindness! You make us #PortageProud!

Please enter the PHS campus on the north access road off of Lute Road and follow our officers' directions through the campus. You will exit onto Route 6. For the health and safety of our community, please remain in your vehicle and do not park or congregate.

Senior spring athletes: You and your family will receive more information from the athletic department and your coaches.

We look forward to seeing you on May 1 as we take part in this national initiative to celebrate spring athletes! #PortageProud

Please visit our website at www.portage.k12.in.us and click on the Registration link.
